definition: profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
money/wealth/riches/property/valuables
root/source/origin
to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!
to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!

sentences.english: High-quality goods and high-rank service enable them to gain profits from all sides.
sentences.chinese: 優質商品和優質服務，使他們財源滾滾。

sentences.english: Or “sell your soul and the money follows.
sentences.chinese: 或者說，“出賣你的靈魂而財源滾滾”。

sentences.english: Plastic surgery is becoming a billion-pound industry in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 在英國，整容手術正成爲財源滾滾的牟利行業。

sentences.english: Now the money is rolling in and he"s living on easy street."
sentences.chinese: 現在，他的財源滾滾，生活得可消遙自在啦。

sentences.english: I also wish the boss career, exchequer billow.
sentences.chinese: 我也祝願老總事業順利，財源滾滾。

sentences.english: The contract to supply computers to schools was a licence to print money.
sentences.chinese: 這個給學校提供電腦的合同真是像印錢一樣財源滾滾。

definition: Happy New Year
ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
thriving and prosperous business or trade
Happy New Year!
May you have peace year after year (New Year's greeting)
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
old but still full of vitality (idiom)
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
lit. (may you) have abundance year after year/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
to arrive home/facing one's home/home-coming/(soccer) facing the goalmouth
god of wealth/very wealthy man
(in the spring) nature takes on a new look (idiom)
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
a new year begins (idiom)
